meanings.definition: A small, luminescent insect that emits light.
meanings.sent1: In the dark forest, the glowworms lit up the night with their tiny lights.
meanings.sent2: I went camping and saw beautiful glowworms lighting up the bushes.
meanings.sent3: The glowworms had a party and their lights danced around the trees.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a cluster of glowworms, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The cave was filled with glowworms, creating a magical atmosphere.

meanings.definition: The larval form of a firefly that emits light.
meanings.sent1: During summer nights, the glowworms flew around the garden, lighting up the flowers.
meanings.sent2: My sister caught a glowworm and watched it light up her palm.
meanings.sent3: The glowworms decided to have a race to see who could light up first.
meanings.sent4: The glowworms in the jar looked like tiny stars trapped in glass.
meanings.sent5: The jar of glowworms on the bedside table acted as a nightlight for the child.

meanings.definition: A bioluminescent worm-like creature found in caves.
meanings.sent1: Exploring the dark cave, we stumbled upon a group of glowworms illuminating the walls.
meanings.sent2: The tour guide pointed out the glowworms hanging from the ceiling of the cave.
meanings.sent3: The glowworms in the cave seemed to be having a glow-in-the-dark party.
meanings.sent4: The glowworms in the cave were like living lanterns guiding our path.
meanings.sent5: The glowworms in the cave created a mystical ambiance, like stars underground.
